Round of 32 | image = | event = [[2009â10 Copa del Rey]]
[[2009â10 Copa del Rey#Round of 32|Round of 32]] | team1 = [[AD AlcorcÃ³n|AlcorcÃ³n]] | team1association = | team1score = 4 | team2 = [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] | team2association = | team2score = 0 | details = AlcorcÃ³n qualify for the [[2009â10 Copa del Rey#Round of 16|Round of 16]] | firstleg = First leg | team1score1 = 4 | team2score1 = 0 | details1 = | date1 = 27 October 2009 | stadium1 = [[Municipal de Santo Domingo (AlcorcÃ³n)|Estadio Santo Domingo]] | city1 = [[AlcorcÃ³n]], [[Community of Madrid|Madrid]], [[Spain]] | man_of_the_match1a = [[Borja PÃ©rez]] (AlcorcÃ³n) | man_of_the_match1atitle = | man_of_the_match1b = | man_of_the_match1btitle = | referee1 = Javier Turienzo Ãlvarez | attendance1 = 3,000 | weather1 = Warm night | previous = | next = }} '''Alcorconazo''' is the name given to one of the [[2009â10 Copa del Rey]] round of 32 eliminatories by the supporters and the Spanish sports press.[http://www.elpais.com/articulo/deportes/Alcorconazo/elpepudep/20091027elpepudep_14/Tes Alcorconazo], El PaÃ­s.com {{es}}, [[October 27]] [[2009]] It received this name because of the stunning defeat of [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], one of the biggest teams in [[Football in Spain|Spanish football]], by [[AD AlcorcÃ³n]], a modest team which then played in the third-tier [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n B]]. This defeat was a lead sports story throughout Europe, being the title page in [[United Kingdom|British]],[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/8329227.stm Minnows knock Madrid out of cup] [[BBC]] Sport {{en}}, November 11, 2009 [[France|French]][http://www.francefootball.fr/FF/breves2009/20091028_001956_alcorcon-chauffe-a-blanc.html Alcorcon donne la leÃ§on au Real] France Football {{fr}}, October 28, 2009 and [[Italy|Italian]] publications.[http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Estero/27-10-2009/real-tonfo-clamoroso--601770098503.shtml Real una dÃ©bacle storica perde 4-0 con squadra di C] Gazzetta.it {{it}}, October 27, 2009 It also marked a rise to relative prominence for the [[AlcorcÃ³n|suburban Madrid]] club; in what may or may not have been a coincidence, AlcorcÃ³n began a major stadium renovation project the following month. The half-time substitution of [[Guti (footballer)|Guti]] when the score was 3–0 and when he was booked before was another topic in the Spanish press because of words exchanged between the player and his coach, [[Manuel Pellegrini]].[http://www.marca.com/2009/10/28/futbol/equipos/real_madrid/1256729859.html Pellegrini y Guti discutieron en el descanso y el jugador mandÃ³ al tÃ©cnico a tomar por el c***] [[MARCA]].com {{es}}, October 28, 2009 It generated superstition and the number of the 4–0 day, the 27th October 2009, (27,109) was one of the best-selling lottery tickets on Christmas 2009.[http://www.leonoticias.com/frontend/leonoticias/Tiene-El-27109-vn40200-vst216 Â¿Tiene el 27109?], Leonoticias.com {{es}}, November 30, 2009 Both matches were broadcasted for the entire country on [[Canal+ Spain|Canal +]]. == Match reports == === Round of 32 === {{TwoLegStart}} {{TwoLegResult|'''[[AD AlcorcÃ³n|AlcorcÃ³n]]''' ||4â1| [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]]||4–0|0–1}} |} === First leg === {{Footballbox |date=27 October 2009 |time=22:00 [[Central European Time|CET]] |team1=[[AD AlcorcÃ³n|AlcorcÃ³n]] |score=4 – 0 |report=[http://actas.rfef.es/actas/RFEF_CmpPartido?cod_primaria=1000144&CodActa=9496 Report] |round=First leg |team2=[[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] |goals1=[[Borja PÃ©rez]] {{goal|16||53}}
